snippet: Many senior U.N. staff did not “perceive the prevention of killing of civilians as their responsibility,” draft U.N. review states.
abstract: Many senior U.N. staff did not “perceive the prevention of killing of civilians as their responsibility,” draft U.N. review states.
lead_paragraph: “An internal review of how the United Nations handled the bloody final months of Sri Lanka’s civil war in 2009, when as many as 40,000 civilians were killed, has concluded that the response was ‘a grave failure of the U.N.,'” according to a leaked draft of the report, Robert Mackey wrote in The New York Times’s Lede blog. Read more »

headline.main: Leaked Report on Sri Lanka Critical of U.N.
